replies.bodyText:
This task is already optional, it is not linked to any build task.
It can be run by running ligradle reformatPdl, we don't have to remove it later. One way this can be used is to auto format PDL files. MP owners can use this to keep the formatting consistent.
replies.author: karthikbalasub

timeline.bodyText:
I am sorry that my last suggestion introduced an error. I misunderstood "MULTILINE" mode. This mode actually match "$" to "any arbitrary" line's ending. (not current or each line)
Under MULTILINE mode, the correct regular expression should be \s+?$ so that '\s' is not greedily matching consecutive empty line.
see example: https://regex101.com/r/TfmGhW/1
timeline.author: junchuanwang

replies.bodyText:
Junchuan, np, and thanks for digging into the issue.
In this case, I prefer to keep it simple and not change it. Since we are generating the PDL output, we control the whitespaces that needs trimming. And since we use only spaces, this is good.
